data.title: Cryptocurrency Market Rebounds Amid Geopolitical Tensions
data.description: On March 1, the cryptocurrency market experienced a significant rebound during early Asian trading hours following reports of Iranian Supreme Leader Khamenei's death in a U.S.-Israeli military operation. According to BlockBeats, Bitcoin surged by 2.21% to reach $68,196 before settling around $67,300, after a previous day's decline of 3.8%. Ethereum also saw a rise of 4.58%, surpassing the $2,000 mark.Data indicates that after losing approximately $128 billion in market value the previous day, the crypto market recovered about $32 billion by Sunday morning. Analysts suggest that due to the 24/7 trading nature of cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin acted as a 'liquidity pressure valve' during the weekend's geopolitical conflict escalation, absorbing selling pressure that might have otherwise spread to stock, bond, and commodity markets.Despite the rebound, uncertainty remains as Iran has retaliated against multiple locations, including Israel, Qatar, UAE, and Bahrain, and has threatened further strikes on U.S.-related bases. Some traders believe that true price discovery may occur once U.S. stock markets and Bitcoin ETFs resume trading on Monday.The derivatives market also experienced significant volatility. Analysis shows that Bitcoin derivatives saw a surge in sell-off volume of approximately $1.8 billion in a single hour last Saturday, indicating a rise in short-term risk aversion. Meanwhile, tokenized commodity contracts linked to oil, gold, and silver on decentralized trading platform Hyperliquid also saw price increases.

data.title: The Israeli military claims to have completed a new round of airstrikes against Iran, targeting approximately 30 targets.
data.description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) have completed a new round of airstrikes against Iranian ballistic missile launchers and air defense systems. The IDF stated that on the night of the 28th, dozens of fighter jets struck approximately 30 targets, including air defense systems, missile launchers, and other military installations. (Jinshi)

data.title: Iran launched a new round of missiles at Israel; the Israeli military claims its defense system has been activated.
data.description: Iran launched a new wave of missiles at Israel. The Israel Defense Forces subsequently confirmed that they had detected missiles launched from Iran and heading towards Israeli territory, and that their defense systems were intercepting the threat. Israel stated that its frontline command had issued preventative instructions to residents in the affected areas, requiring them to move into protected areas and stand by upon receiving an alert. Earlier reports indicated that Iran had attacked a US military base in northern Iraq, with witnesses reporting thick smoke rising from the base. The situation continues to develop. (Tehran Times)

data.title: Russia Launches Terror Probe Into Telegram CEO Durov In Criminal Case
data.description:

data.title: OpenAI Founder Discusses Constitutional Compliance in Military Orders
data.description: OpenAI founder Sam Altman addressed concerns regarding the execution of potentially unconstitutional orders from the U.S. Department of Defense. According to Jin10, Altman stated that he does not foresee such a situation occurring. He emphasized that if OpenAI were certain an order was unconstitutional, they would not comply with it. Altman highlighted his belief that military personnel tend to be more loyal to the Constitution than the general public. He also noted that OpenAI, as a company, should not operate above the U.S. Constitution.

data.title: Increased Defense Spending May Lead to Political Interference and Margin Challenges
data.description: The Wall Street Journal (Markets) posted on X that rising defense budgets could result in heightened political involvement and potential negative impacts on profit margins. As governments allocate more funds to defense, companies in the sector may face increased scrutiny and pressure from political entities. This situation could lead to challenges in maintaining profitability, as political agendas might influence business operations and decision-making processes. The article suggests that while increased spending can boost revenue for defense contractors, it also brings complexities that could affect their financial performance.

data.title: PRECIOUS METALS | Silver Usage in Missiles: Misconceptions and Reality
data.description: A report from CPM Group highlights misconceptions about silver usage in missiles. According to Jin10, some promoters have claimed that missiles worldwide consume large amounts of silver in a non-recoverable manner, with assertions that each 'Tomahawk' missile contains 482 or 500 ounces of silver. However, informed sources reveal that the actual silver content in a 'Tomahawk' missile is approximately 10 to 15 ounces, primarily found in solder and ignition batteries, rather than the exaggerated figures. Smaller missiles used in regions like Ukraine and the Middle East reportedly contain less than an ounce of silver, also located in solder and ignition batteries.

data.title: Kalshi CEO Addresses Market Rules Amid Khamenei's Death Speculation
data.description:
Kalshi CEO Tarek Mansour recently discussed the speculation surrounding Ayatollah Khamenei's death and related prediction market events on X. According to Odaily, Mansour emphasized that Kalshi does not list markets directly tied to death. Instead, they design rules to prevent profit from such outcomes.

In response to the event concerning 'Khamenei stepping down as Supreme Leader,' Kalshi will implement specific measures:

1. All fees for this market will be refunded.

2. For users who opened positions before Khamenei's death, settlements will be based on the last trading price before his passing.

3. Users who opened positions after Khamenei's death will receive full compensation for their costs.

Mansour further assured, "No user will lose a dollar in this market. We will settle the market based on the last transaction price before Khamenei's death, which was at 1:14 AM Eastern Time today."
